activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond J. LaPuma

records.addlTxt:
8:46 AM Judge Mary Roth Burns presiding with Judge Michael Bloom. Defendant Raymond J. LaPuma in court. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Raymond J. LaPuma. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF91 & 22TR1264. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Richards willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Defendant to appear in person at next appearance.  Bond continued. adj. 08:49 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Raymond J. LaPuma in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Raymond J. LaPuma. 
Also calling 22tr1264.
In receipt of complaint, waive reading. Set for preliminary. Time limits waived.  22tr1264 to track for status. 
Bail continued. Updated Phone number provided.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.
